meanings.definition: A type of white blood cell that helps the body fight off infections.
meanings.sent1: Neutrophils are like tiny soldiers that protect our bodies from germs.
meanings.sent2: Doctors can check the number of neutrophils in your blood to see if you have an infection.
meanings.sent3: The neutrophils were on high alert, ready to battle any invading bacteria.
meanings.sent4: Her immune system's neutrophils were a fierce army, swiftly attacking any threats.
meanings.sent5: The neutrophils swarmed the infection like a team of superheroes, defeating the villains.

meanings.definition: Neutrophils are the most abundant type of white blood cell in the human body.
meanings.sent1: In the body, neutrophils outnumber other white blood cells by a large margin.
meanings.sent2: When you get sick, your body produces more neutrophils to help fight off the illness.
meanings.sent3: The neutrophils partied like they were the popular kids of the immune system.
meanings.sent4: Her bloodstream was a bustling city, with neutrophils as the busy workers keeping everything in order.
meanings.sent5: The neutrophils were like a bustling army base, always ready for action.
